metadata.synopsis: Origin moment for Minsc + Jaheira with Boss Friol.After Minsc learns of the Zhentarim plans to overthrow Nine-Fingers, he returns to the Guildhall to confront their leader, Roah. She taunts him with his past evil deeds as the 'Stone Lord' - the player decideds whether to back Minsc and fight Roah, or let Roah's plan come to fruition for the 'greater good'.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Go to Guildhall. (S_LOW_Guildhall_Entrance_a78a0b7b-489a-4743-9e6e-4c88f24cc2ca)Swap Roah with Friol by using ReCon: oe Guildhall_Swap_ZhentLeader Recruit Minsc + optionally jaheiraInitiate the Zhent takeover of the Guild by using ReCon: oe Guildhall_ZhentBetrayal

23.speaker: Boss Friol
23.text: So it's that simple! Drop your weapons, bring out Nine-Fingers, and this can all end peacefully! For you, at least.
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party enters the Guildhall to find Friol standing at the railing, addressing the crwod. Her Zhentarim stand arrayed for battle, with the Guild standing defensively against them. She finishes her line, and turns to greet us.

33.speaker: Boss Friol
33.text: What's this, Stone Lord? Bit late to change the terms of our deal - we've already begun.
33.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

51.speaker: Minsc
51.text: The Stone Lord is no more. Boo and Jaheira and my friend would not let me stay cursed.
51.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

50.speaker: Minsc
50.text: And the only terms we offer are between my boot and your treacherous buttocks.
50.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

56.speaker: Boss Friol
56.text: Unfortunate. But if you'll only listen a moment, you'll see we want the same thing.
56.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

57.speaker: Minsc
57.text: Oh? Minsc is wanting to close your mouth with a kick. And you?
57.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

8.speaker: Boss Friol
8.text: Justice. Nine-Fingers, punished for what she did to you. And the Zhentarim, rewarded for their stead-fastedness.
8.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

43.speaker: Boss Friol
43.text: The Zhentarim have been trying to crack Baldur's Gate for years. No better time than now, with Nine-Fingers on the back foot.
43.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

29.speaker: Boss Friol
29.text: A Guild under our control can do what Nine-Fingers failed to - drive the Absolute out of the city, once and for all.
29.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

54.speaker: Boss Friol
54.text: And then reap the spoils. Stay on in the city, as its true protectors. For a reasonable fee, of course.
54.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

53.speaker: Minsc
53.text: My hamster can smell your lies, villain. Foul not his little nose.
53.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

37.speaker: Boss Friol
37.text: Let's have the truth, then. Do your friends know how many you killed in the Absolute's name, Stone Lord? Do you?
37.context: NodeContext: Thrown, but insistent - he does not want to remember the things he did.

31.speaker: Minsc
31.text: I... do not call me that. Minsc is Minsc!
31.context: NodeContext: Thrown, but insistent - he does not want to remember the things he did.

45.speaker: Boss Friol
45.text: Funny that. The Minsc of the old days would've been no friend to Nine-Fingers - a known thief, a murderer. That Minsc served the side of good.
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowing his head, dejectedNodeContext: For once, has no response

4.speaker: Minsc
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowing his head, dejectedNodeContext: For once, has no response

64.speaker: Boss Friol
64.text: No judgement. It's hard to know the right thing. Better to let others do the thinking, eh?
64.context: NodeContext: Raising his head, no longer despondent.

58.speaker: Minsc
58.context: NodeContext: Raising his head, no longer despondent.

11.speaker: Minsc
11.text: Your leader is not wrong. The Guild is a band of treacherous scoundrels, and Nine-Fingers the worst among them!
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc looking up, dejection to hope. He nods and steps forward to stand beside Roah, facing the gathered Zhentarim below.

16.speaker: Minsc
16.text: But the Stone Lord... Minsc... was many times worse. I have no right to judge.
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standard animation as he reaches into inventory out of frame - and comes back with Boo in his hand, held over the crowd.NodeContext: Include gesture of getting Boo from magic pocket and holding in front of him, Boo sat in Minsc's Palm.

38.speaker: Minsc
38.text: So it will not be Minsc who does the judging.
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standard animation as he reaches into inventory out of frame - and comes back with Boo in his hand, held over the crowd.NodeContext: Include gesture of getting Boo from magic pocket and holding in front of him, Boo sat in Minsc's Palm.

26.speaker: Minsc
26.text: MY HAMSTER WILL COUNT TO THREE! LAY DOWN YOUR ARMS, ZHENTARIM, AND BOO WILL SPARE YOUR LIVES!

52.speaker: Boss Friol
52.text: Think about this. It defies all logic, I -

63.speaker: Boss Friol
63.text: So it's that simple! Drop your weapons, bring out Nine-Fingers, and this can all end peacefully! For you, at least.
63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party enters the Guildhall to find Friol standing at the railing, addressing the crwod. Her Zhentarim stand arrayed for battle, with the Guild standing defensively against them. She finishes her line, and turns to greet us.

62.speaker: Boss Friol
62.text: What's this, Stone Lord? Bit late to change the terms of our deal - we've already begun.
62.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

12.speaker: Minsc
12.text: The Stone Lord is no more. Boo and Jaheira and my friend would not let me stay cursed.
12.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

55.speaker: Minsc
55.text: And the only terms we offer are between my boot and your treacherous buttocks.
55.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

28.speaker: Boss Friol
28.text: A pity, that. And he speaks for you, too?
28.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

6.speaker: Boss Friol
6.text: I may have lied to that lot about this ending peacefully. But you can still pick the right side.
6.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

61.speaker: Player
61.text: What are you doing? Why turn on the Guild?
61.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

36.speaker: Boss Friol
36.text: We're turning on Nine-Fingers. She's been running this place into the ground for some time.

32.speaker: Player
32.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

2.speaker: Boss Friol
2.text: The Zhentarim have been trying to crack Baldur's Gate for years. No better time than now, with Nine-Fingers on the back foot.
2.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

24.speaker: Boss Friol
24.text: Her Guild is a shambles. The cult broke them in a matter of days - but not the Zhentarim.
24.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

20.speaker: Boss Friol
20.text: A Guild under our control can do what Nine-Fingers failed to - drive the Absolute out of the city, once and for all.
20.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

17.speaker: Boss Friol
17.text: And then reap the spoils. Stay on in the city, as its true protectors. For a reasonable fee, of course.
17.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

1.speaker: Minsc
1.text: My hamster can smell your lies, villain. Foul not his little nose.
1.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

14.speaker: Boss Friol
14.text: Let's have the truth, then. Do your friends know how many you killed in the Absolute's name, Stone Lord? Do you?
14.context: NodeContext: Thrown, but insistent - he does not want to remember the things he did.

22.speaker: Minsc
22.text: I... do not call me that. Minsc is Minsc!
22.context: NodeContext: Thrown, but insistent - he does not want to remember the things he did.

60.speaker: Boss Friol
60.text: Funny that. The Minsc of the old days would've been no friend to Nine-Fingers - a known thief, a murderer. That Minsc served the side of good.
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowing his head, dejectedNodeContext: For once, has no response

47.speaker: Minsc
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowing his head, dejectedNodeContext: For once, has no response

35.speaker: Boss Friol
35.text: No judgement, big lad. Some people give orders. Some people follow 'em. You know which you are, now.

44.speaker: Boss Friol
44.text: Just leave it to us grown-ups. Because I know your friend will make the smart choice.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: You're mistaken. Minsc of Rashemen always knows the right thing to do.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc looking up, dejection to hope. He nods and steps forward to stand beside Roah, facing the gathered Zhentarim below.

3.speaker: Minsc
3.text: Your leader is not wrong. The Guild is a band of treacherous scoundrels, and Nine-Fingers the worst among them!
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc looking up, dejection to hope. He nods and steps forward to stand beside Roah, facing the gathered Zhentarim below.

7.speaker: Minsc
7.text: But the Stone Lord... Minsc... was many times worse. I have no right to judge.
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standard animation as he reaches into inventory out of frame - and comes back with Boo in his hand, held over the crowd.NodeContext: Include gesture of getting Boo from magic pocket and holding in front of him, Boo sat in Minsc's Palm.

34.speaker: Minsc
34.text: So it will not be Minsc who does the judging.
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standard animation as he reaches into inventory out of frame - and comes back with Boo in his hand, held over the crowd.NodeContext: Include gesture of getting Boo from magic pocket and holding in front of him, Boo sat in Minsc's Palm.

27.speaker: Minsc
27.text: MY HAMSTER WILL COUNT TO THREE! LAY DOWN YOUR ARMS, ZHENTARIM, AND BOO WILL SPARE YOUR LIVES!

30.speaker: Boss Friol
30.text: Truly? I am handing you the Guild, and you'd throw it all away on the word of a madman?

13.speaker: Boss Friol
13.text: Think about this. It defies all logic, I -

15.speaker: Player
15.text: We stand with the Guild. So get out of the way.

21.speaker: Boss Friol
21.text: You're making a big mistake. And for what? There's no sense in this - no profit. Nobody goes against the Zhent and lives.

39.speaker: Minsc
39.text: Enough of your filth. Cover your ears Boo. The cracking of the necks of evil will be louder than the mating cries of a snow tiger.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Fine. Give your Zhentarim the order - we take this place, and split the spoils.

25.speaker: Minsc
25.text: Why would you side with this villain? Boo does not... I do not understand.

48.speaker: Boss Friol
48.text: Cheer up, Minsc - this is about the greater good. Maybe your hamster will explain it to you one day.
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: She cups a hand beside her ear in the direction of Nine-Fingers' office.

49.speaker: Boss Friol
49.text: Enough negotiations, Zhentarim! It's time to take our due!
49.context: NodeContext: Turning to shout at her people gathered below.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: I will. But I don't think you'll like my choice.

10.speaker: Boss Friol
10.text: You're smarter than this. You know which way the wind's blowing.
